title: Quaid taken into custody in Vermont trying to cross border
text:
Peter McCabe Quaid taken into custody in Vermont trying to cross border 
Actor Randy Quaid arrives at his Immigration and Refugee Board hearing in Montreal, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015. Quaid said in an interview that he could be deported from Canada next week and that he would like to resolve his legal issues in California and "move on with my life." The actor and his Canadian wife fled the U.S. in 2010, saying they were victims of persecution. (Peter McCabe/The Canadian Press via AP) Peter McCabe Quaid taken into custody in Vermont trying to cross border 
Actor Randy Quaid, right, is escorted into his Immigration and Refugee Board hearing in Montreal, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015. Quaid said in an interview that he could be deported from Canada next week and that he would like to resolve his legal issues in California and "move on with my life." The actor and his Canadian wife fled the U.S. in 2010, saying they were victims of persecution. (Peter McCabe/The Canadian Press via AP) Posted: Saturday, October 10, 2015 2:16 am Quaid taken into custody in Vermont trying to cross border Associated Press | 0 comments 
HIGHGATE, Vt. (AP) â€” Vermont State Police say actor Randy Quaid has been taken into custody while trying to cross from Canada into the United States. 
State Police say the "Independence Day" actor was detained by troopers at the Highgate Springs port of entry on Friday night, days after Canadian officials said he would be deported. Quaid is wanted in Santa Barbara, California, to face felony vandalism charges filed in 2010 after he and his wife, Evi, were found squatting in a guesthouse of a home they previously owned. 
The pair skipped several court appearances and went to Canada, where Evi Quaid was granted citizenship. Randy Quaid's bid to gain permanent residency was denied. 
The 65-year-old Quaid told The Associated Press earlier this week that he wanted to resolve his legal troubles in California.
